item.title: Report E-2024080103
item.description:
Report E-2024080103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XLF contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 gallon of "BW Papersystems Razorlube" from a 55-gallon metal drum, impacting the trailer floor. Another pallet was improperly loaded, falling onto and crushing the drum. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE.

item.title: Report E-2024080027
item.description:
Report E-2024080027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 25, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the sodium hydroxide-impacted trailer and dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080021
item.description:
Report E-2024080021

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 23, 2024, sixteen (16) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately sixteen (16) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted areas. All waste was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums.
